result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Glen G Mangan was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Glen G Mangan was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Glen G Mangan in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing argument by the State.  Statement by victim.  Sentencing argument by Atty. Borda. Statement by defendant.  

COUNT 1 

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

60 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
- 24 months of Initial Confinement
- 36 months of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:
- Take Anger Managment Course:
- Take Domestic Violence Course;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with victim, victim's family, victim's residence;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge.

Restitution: $6022.67  BAIL TO APPLY

Costs: $268.00 BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00 BAIL TO APPLY

Condition Time: 5 months Huber- NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Defendant remanded to the custody of the sheriff.
Defendant allowed 2 phone calls

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program


COUNT 4

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of 

60 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).    CONSECUTIVE TO CONDITION TIME IN COUNT1

FINE:  $ 1242.00 BAIL TO APPLY
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukesha Sheriff's Department.  BAIL TO APPLY

DL REVOCATION:   12 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 12 months.

Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through


Felony warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Glen G Mangan in court with Attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caes called for jury status, however Defendant now enters a no contest plea to Count #1 and guilty plea to Count #4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 & 4.  Enhancers are stricken on Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Count #5 is dismissed by operation of law.  State requests a later sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
